messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 60 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: Continuum modelling of stress diffusion interactions in an elastoplastic medium in the presence of geometric discontinuity

Paper Abstract: Abstract Chemo-mechanical coupled systems have been a subject of interest for many decades now. Previous attempts to solve such models have mainly focused on elastic materials without taking into account the plastic deformation beyond yield, thus causing inaccuracies in failure calculations. This paper aims to study the effect of stress-diffusion interactions in an elastoplastic material using a coupled chemo-mechanical system. The induced stress is dependent on the local concentration in a one way coupled system, and vice versa in a two way coupled system. The time-dependent transient coupled system is solved using a finite element formulation in an open-source finite element solver FEniCS. This paper attempts to computationally study the interaction of deformation and diffusion and its effect on the localization of plastic strain. We investigate the role of geometric discontinuities in scenarios involving diffusing species, namely, a plate with a notch/hole/void and particle with a void/hole/core. We also study the effect of stress concentrations and plastic yielding on the diffusion-deformation. The developed code can be from https://github.com/mrupeshkumar/Elastoplastic-stress-diffusion-coupling

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 60 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 60"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "Crack initiation in hydrogenated steel",
        "Memory effect in a lithium-ion battery",
        "Diffusion of chloride ions in hardened cement pastes",
        "Quantitative law of diffusion induced fracture",
        "On the Larche-Cahn theory for stress-induced diffusion",
        "A uniform hydrogen degradation law for high strength steels",
        "Hydrogen degradation effects on mechanical properties in T24",
        "Failure mechanisms of single-crystal silicon electrodes in lithium-ion batteries",
        "Electrochemical stiffness in lithium-ion batteries",
        "Stress, deformation and diffusion interactions in solids-a simulation study",
        "A phase-field approach to fracture coupled with diffusion",
        "Meso-scale modeling of chloride diffusion in concrete with consideration of effects of time and temperature",
        "A mechanistic theory of hydrogen embrittlement of steels",
        "Effects of hydrogen on the properties of iron and steel",
        "Stress-induced diffusion of hydrogen in metallic membranes: cylindrical vs. planar formulation. II.",
        "Modeling of hydrogen-assisted ductile crack propagation in metals and alloys",
        "Modelling of hydrogen diffusion and hydrogen induced cracking in supermartensitic and duplex stainless steels",
        "Effects of hydrogen on steady, ductile crack growth: Computational studies",
        "Atomic mechanism and prediction of hydrogen embrittlement in iron",
        "The diffusion and trapping of hydrogen in high purity aluminium",
        "Hydrogen solubility and diffusion in the shape-memory alloy NiTi",
        "The location of atomic hydrogen in niti alloy: A first principles study",
        "A coupled model between hydrogen diffusion and mechanical behavior of superelastic NiTi alloys",
        "Diffusion in biofilms",
        "A two-dimensional continuum model of biofilm growth incorporating fluid flow and shear stress based detachment",
        "A combined extended finite element and level set method for biofilm growth",
        "Fracture Analysis of the cathode in Li-Ion Batteries: A Simulation study",
        "Electrochemical shock of intercalation electrodes: A fracture mechanics analysis",
        "Modeling diffusion-induced stress in nanowire electrode structures",
        "A surface locking instability for atomic intercalation into a solid electrode",
        "Numerical simulation of intercalation induced stress in li ion battery electrode particles",
        "Averting cracks caused by insertion reaction in lithium–ion batteries",
        "Stress generation and fracture in lithium insertion materials",
        "Design criteria for nanostructured li-ion batteries",
        "“electrochemical shock” of intercalation electrodes: A fracture mechanics analysis",
        "Cohesive modeling of crack nucleation under diffusion induced stresses in a thin strip: Implications on the critical size for flaw tolerant battery electrodes",
        "Mechanical modeling of particles with active Core-Shell structures for lithium-ion battery electrodes",
        "Numerical simulation of intercalation-induced stress in li-ion battery electrode particles",
        "3D isogeometric analysis of intercalation-induced stresses in li-ion battery electrode particles",
        "Stress fields in hollow core & shell spherical electrodes of lithium ion batteries",
        "Elasticity and size effects on the electrochemical response of a graphite, li-ion battery electrode particle",
        "Effects of stress-diffusion interactions in an isotropic elastic medium in the presence of geometric discontinuities",
        "Influence of plastic deformation on hydrogen diffusion and permeation in stainless steels",
        "Hydrogen induced plasticity in stress corrosion cracking of engineering systems",
        "Effects of hydrogen on deformation and fracture processes in high-ourity aluminium",
        "Interaction between diffusion and chemical stresses",
        "Modelling the coupling between hydrogen diffusion and the mechanical behaviour of metals",
        "Hydrogen effects on the plasticity of fcc nickel and austenitic alloys",
        "Hydrogen-enhanced localized plasticity—a mechanism for hydrogen-related fracture",
        "The effect of hydrogen on the yield and flow stress of an austenitic stainless steel",
        "Evaluation of hydrogen stresses in metal and redistribution of hydrogen around crack-like defects",
        "Numerical analysis of hydrogen transport near a blunting crack tip",
        "In situ measurements of stress evolution in silicon thin films during electrochemical lithiation and delithiation",
        "Cyclic plasticity and shakedown in high-capacity electrodes of lithium-ion batteries",
        "A finite strain model of stress, diffusion, plastic flow, and electrochemical reactions in a lithium-ion half-cell",
        "Large plastic deformation in high-capacity lithium-ion batteries caused by charge and discharge",
        "Inelastic hosts as electrodes for high-capacity lithium-ion batteries",
        "Characterization of plasticity and fracture of shell casing of lithium-ion cylindrical battery",
        "The fenics project version 1.5",
        "Abaqus documentation"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 60 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in Continuum modelling of stress diffusion interactions in an elastoplastic medium in the presence of geometric discontinuity, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
